Row.Text: Indeed.
All right.
Certainly.
It is agreed.
Oh, very well.
I suppose I must.
It is done.
I shall have porridge for dinner, I think.
We shall destroy you, you know. Do you care for some cheese?
Oh well. I presume you know what you're doing.
War rides on an iron-footed steed, leaving white-hot hoof-prints on my brain. The horror! The horror!
I am informed that I have declared war on you. I wonder why?
The demons cry out for the blood of soldiers. To war!
You have done well. I shall put in a good word for you to the demons.
It is over. Perhaps now I shall have peace, at last.
Have I indeed been vanquished? How interesting.
The pain of rats gnawing at your vitals would be as nothing compared to the anguish you will suffer should you refuse my demands.
Does raw, blind greed make me a bad person? I wonder...
The following tribute would improve my black humor, greatly increasing the odds that you would survive another day.
The dead whisper "no" in my ears.
No.
Certainly not.
We decline.
Of course not.
That's unacceptable.
You cannot be serious!
I beg your pardon?
I am Ozymandias of the Ultimate Empire. Those fools outside say I'm a god, but that seems unlikely. Who are you?
I am Ozymandias, ruler of the Ultimate Empire. I earnestly pray that you are not just another idiot sent here to waste my time.
I am Ozymandias. King of Kings. Have you come to witness the wonders of my hand?
I feel the rage coming upon me. You had best be gone.
Goodbye.
Until we meet again.
Go away now.
That is all.
Go away now - I would sip the cup of despair in solitude.
Welcome. Please ignore the screaming.
Have we met?
Greetings.
Oh, it's you.
Well? Speak up. I can barely hear you over the blood pounding in my brain.
What do you want?
Speak.
Go ahead.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Yes?
You were saying?
And?
Go on.
Foolish, foolish – letting me live. You should always destroy your foes branch, trunk and root.
Do not make me angry: I can be quite terrible when the rage is upon me. Improve your offer.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Almost…
My advisors inform me that your offer is not acceptable. Why does a god need 'advisors' anyway? They gibber at me like monkeys.
Is that the best you can do?
You're almost there…
Almost…
Not acceptable. Improve your offer or go away – I must feed the scorpions.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost…
I have conceived of a blind, almost overpowering dislike for you. The answer is 'no.'
I am sorry, but the voices tell me that I must decline your offer.
Your offer is declined. I would be insulted – if I cared anything about you.
I am told that the quickest way to make you go is to agree to your terms.
Very well. Not that it will help either of us in the long run – we all die, you know.Excellent. It is agreed.
You are less objectionable than many; I agree to your terms.
You would allay my all-consuming misery by agreeing to the following.
It appears that you do have a reason for existing – to make this deal with me.
Much to my astonishment, you have something that I need. Will you trade for it?
Does the rat demand tribute from the butterfly? I think not.
I will give you a thousand singing concubines in the next world, but in this world you get nothing.
Foolish Jackal – you would do well to go to Egypt, where such as you are worshipped. Here you get nothing.
Your fetid breath chokes the life from me – take what you would and be gone.
Here. I am nothing but the nightmare of a mad god – what good are such things to me?
I agree – if only to confound my advisors, who urge me to refuse.
The drums – the drums! They pound in my brain, drowning out thoughts of vengeance.
How disappointing.
How very disappointing.
The next time I shall not be so polite.
That was refreshing. If the demons are sated, perhaps they will give us a little respite now.
